page.title: 02 Places of worship
page.content: The Church of St.Werburgh is an old building,standing on the edge of a deep valley .There is a nave with two aisles,a chancel,and a tower containing a clock and 8 bells.In the chancel there are some wonderful wall paintings showing some scenes from the life of Jesus.There are also some wonderful alabaster monuments. The Vicar is Rev.F Powell and the organist is Mr M Russell. The Churchwardens are Mr R.A.S.Evans and Mr.S.Wynn. On the Second,Third and Fourth Sundays in the month the main service is at 10.00am.On the First Sunday in the month it is at 11.15am. Hanbury Methodist Church was built in 1923 and has its own burial ground. It is in the Tutbury circuit.
